my:courseDetails.my:title: SharePoint Administrators Survival Camp
my:courseDetails.my:description: This exclusive training course is a one-time event led by SharePoint industry-leading experts Shane Young and Todd Klindt. You will spend 5 intensive days as they drill down on the most important topics and best practices associated with managing and architecting SharePoint Server 2007 farms. You'll learn how to avoid the most common pitfalls and how to design scalable and reliable SharePoint solutions. If you've been waiting for hands-on training with depth and real-world experience to help accelerate your deployment, wait no longer. From capacity planning and Governance to deploying extranets with forms based authentication, don't miss this one time offering packed into a single week.
my:courseDetails.my:prerequisites: This training course requires all attendees to bring their own laptop computer with Virtual PC 2007 pre-installed and with at least 2GB of RAM. Each attendee laptop should have at least 20GB of free disk space on an internal or external hard drive. All campers should have professional experience with system administration in a Windows network environment and experience installing and configuring Windows Server 2003, Active Directory and SQL Server. SharePoint Administration with WSS 2.0/3.0 or SPS2003/MOSS 2007 is highly recommended. Note that this training is not designed for developers.
